skeleton module¶

Operations on graph skeleton

skeleton.find_edge_sep(G, statdat, edge, poss_seps, card, sig)[source]¶

Looks for d-separation of a node pair by all conditioning sets of a given cardinality.

Parameters:
  • G – networkx.Graph object
  • statdat – datastats.DataStats object containing statistical data for independence tests
  • edge – candidate node pair (x,y)
  • poss_seps – set of all candidate nodes for inclusion in conditioning set
  • card – cardinality of conditioning set
  • sig – level of significance for independence tests, expressed in # standard deviations
Returns:

G = original ‘G’ with statistical dependence information (dep_stat,stat_test) added to edge

dep_stat = conditional dependence statistic (e.g., partial correlation) stat_test = test statistic for dep_stat (e.g., Fisher’s Z)

cond = conditioning set that successfully d-separates ‘edge’, = None if no such set exists
skeleton.find_test_edge(G, tested_edges, card)[source]¶

Find new eligible edge for test of d-separation with respect to conditioning sets of a given cardinality.

Parameters:
  • G – networkx.Graph object
  • tested_edges – list of edges already tested at this cardinality
  • card – cardinality under test
skeleton.get_skel(G, get_poss_sep, statdat, sig)[source]¶

Removes edges between conditionally independent nodes of completely connected graph.

Parameters:
  • G – networkx.Graph object, normally completely connected
  • get_poss_sep – function to retrieve possible conditioning sets. Depends on algorithm.
  • statdat – datastats.DataStats object containing statistical data for independence tests
  • sig – level of significance for independence tests, expressed in # standard deviations
Returns:

G = original ‘G’ with conditionally independent edges removed. Note: not a copy of G, but the original! sepset = dictionary of d-separation sets. key: d-separated node pair, value: d-separating set for key.
skeleton.init_skel(nodes)[source]¶

Initializes graph from node list in preparation for skeleton retrieval.

Parameters:nodes – list of node names
Returns:G = networkx.Graph object with ‘dep_stat’ attribute for each edge, used to hold statistical dependence

test statistic.
